commitResults.messageTitle: Add function greet, echo and bye
Add functionalities to mark and unmark tasks.
commitResults.messageBody: Added class Task. Added interface ICompletable. Added functions mark, unmark. Updated function list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated class hierarchy and file structure.

commitResults.messageBody:
Added sub classes Deadline, Event and Task.
Updated output of function list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test case and bug fixes
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a test case and used it to identify a bug.
Bugfixes
- Removed an additional echo

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exceptions and error handling, Update test cases
commitResults.messageBody: Added exceptions and invalid input handling for most of the foreseeable errors. Also added additional  invalid input in test case.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add function delete. Update test cases.
commitResults.messageBody: Added functionalities for deleting tasks, also updated test case to include deletion of task and additional invalid input.
Added a storage class that handles the serialization/deserialization of tasks. Updated framework to use existing task list.
Modified the implementation of the deadline and event classes to use date time instead of strings.
Updated the system to save whenever the task list changes rather than only saving at the end of the program

commitResults.messageTitle: Update framework to be more OOP
commitResults.messageBody: Updated the framework by extracting out the functionalities of the DukeManager class into other classes. Added UI, Parser, Command and its subclasses.

Added new packages Commands, Exception, External, Managers, Tasks. Separated all existing classes into respective packages. 
Bug Fixes
- Added the exit command

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename all packages to lower case
commitResults.messageBody: Renaming all packages to start with a lower case
Updated OOP structure by extracting the todo, deadline and event commands into their respective subclasses.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnits for Parser and TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added JUnit for Parser class, with 2 function testing for valid/invalid input for the parse functions.
Added JUnit for TaskList class, testing for valid/invalid input for the respective tasks creation.
Updated output of error messages to end with a line separator.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadocs for functions of source classes
commitResults.messageBody: Added documentation for all source classes and their public functions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update program to follow coding standard
commitResults.messageBody: Made changes to names in the Command and ExitCommand classes to follow the given coding standard.

Updated functionality of parser and task list to incorporate a new find command
Added FindCommand class.
Updated the variable name that represents the description of a tasks from info to description.
Added new JUnit tests for the new find commands
Updated the abstraction of the TaskList class by changing all the values returned by the functions of TaskList from Task to String.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadocs for classes in duke.tasks package
commitResults.messageBody: Added javadocs for all the classes in the duke.tasks package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code structure for ease of future extensions.
commitResults.messageBody: Refactored the structure of the system to be more modular so as to make the program scale easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add gradle support for building and JUnit
commitResults.messageBody: Added gradle support for building of jar files and JUnit tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix all checkstyle errors and warnings
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated code base to be inline with the provided checkstyle. 
Removed external io script.
Added GUI functionalities to the program and updated all classes to support it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update conventions for factory methods of Deadline, Todo and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Factory methods of Deadline, Event and Todo contains different extract-able logic and is very long.

The length of the code exceeds the recommended 30 lines and makes it harder to read.

Extracting the logic for recognizing the different attributes of the respective task from the user input into separate functions. 

Encapsulating the logic for recognizing separate attributes of a task makes the code more concise and readable.

Function initialize in Duke class have unclear paths between the erroneous/unusual and happy clauses of the function.

This violates the happy path prominent technique of java conventions and makes the code slightly unreadable as it can distract readers from the alternative paths.

Separated the logic for rare/error clauses (e.g. when a user uses the program initially) from the happy clause.

This makes the logic for the code more defined as it is properly split into separate sections. As a result the code is easier to read and understand.

Catch clause of function save does not accurately document it's intended behavior as it is common for this exception to be caught (e.g. when a user starts up for the first time).

Printing stack trace can be misinterpreted as a bug occurring in the program.

Removing the stack trace and leaving a documentation indicating that there is no problem would remove any ambiguity.

Because it is a commonly caught exception that does not raise any problem in the system, leaving a javadoc indicating so is sufficient and clear,

Added assertions for execution method in certain Task sub classes and Duke.

Task sub classes: Most of the execute functions in tasks requires and assumes that the task list provided is properly initialized. 

Duke functions: Functions in duke requires the internal managers of the duke to be initialized.

These assertions ensures that the functions are only called in the program loop.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add sort functionalities for task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Requirement to be able to sort the task list according to alphabetical and chronological order.

Functionality allows user to sort and view their task in order.

Add two different sorting functions, one for chronological and one for alphabetical.

This is the two most common ways users would want to view their tasks by.

Current GUI display looks aesthetically unpleasing, the colors looks awkward and there is no differentiation between error response and normal response.

Unfriendly for user to use as the display makes it hard for user to read the response.

Updating the GUI by adding different color schemes to different types of messages. (e.g. error or normal response). Also changed the padding and margin values to make the display look more refined.

Current command responses is not intuitive enough that the user will be able to figure out what the proper format of the commands are.

User might not be able to use the program as intended due to the lack of information in the response message.

Updating the messages to be clearer by displaying what information is missing/erroneous in the command. Also added examples to make it clearer.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add User Guide and representative screenshot
commitResults.messageBody:
Current documentation is insufficient for user to get enough information to use the application effectively.

As such user may be unable to use the application as smoothly as intended.

Adding a user guide and a representative screenshot will give the user something to refer to to get a brief overview and guide of the program.

Current formatting of user guide displays incorrectly in HTML file.

The user guide is not reflecting as intended and can present incorrect information to the user.

Updating the user guide to try to make it display correctly in HTML.

Currently the storage path defined might be ambiguous and cause bugs in certain OSes without properly defined JVM path.

Can cause data to be saved in unintended locations and as a result lose the tasks that has been saved.

Properly defined the saving directory to be in the same directory as the jar file.

Current file saving does not work as intended with directories that contains spaces.

If user saves the jar file in a directory containing spaces, the data file may be saved incorrectly to another directory.

Updating the storage file path to take into account spaces, this should make saving data work as intended regardless of space or not.
